node.title: 'Making Test cricket look easy': 'Dizzy' heaps praise on Boland, reflects on Indigenous heritage
node.alt: Two men in blue cricket uniforms stand side-by-side, talking.
node.description: When he made his Test debutÂ as a 21-year-old tearaway in 1996, Jason Gillespie had no inkling that he was the first Indigenous man to be donning the baggy green.
node.content:
["Throughout his childhood, Jason Gillespie had a strong awareness of his Indigenous heritage.", "But when he made his Test debut\u00a0as a 21-year-old tearaway in 1996, the fact that he was the first Indigenous man to be donning a baggy green was not only lost on the Australian public.", "Gillespie\u00a0was unaware of the milestone himself.", "\"I naively assumed that I couldn't possibly have been the first,\" he told ABC Radio Adelaide.", "\"With our rich, multicultural history in our country, with so many people from so many diverse backgrounds, I just assumed there must have been lots of [Indigenous] cricketers and lots of sportspeople.\"", "When he was finally made aware of the fact, Gillespie was, he admits, \"shocked\" \u2014 but that\u00a0moment of realisation was still a few years away.", "It wasn't until cricket journalist Robert Craddock drew attention to Gillespie's achievement that it became a matter of public knowledge.", "\"He wrote an article a couple of years after my Test and one-day debuts saying that I'm the first acknowledged Indigenous cricketer, Aboriginal cricketer, for Australia,\" Gillespie recalled.", "", "
Audio: Jason Gillespie will be inducted into the Hall of Fame later this year.
", "\"Because it wasn't acknowledged when I first played for Australia, it became a big news story.\"", "If Gillespie was something of a prodigy when it came to fast bowling \u2014 he debuted for the Redbacks at the age of 19 \u2014 Scott Boland is more of a late bloomer.", "But Boland, who is just the second Indigenous Australian man to play Test cricket, more than made up for the belated start by producing one of the most devastating performances on debut in the history of the game.", "\"[It]\u00a0is a wonderful achievement but also I think it shows the strength of our domestic structures in Australian cricket.", "\"To come in and have such an immediate impact I think speaks volumes for the health of our cricketing system.\"", "Gillespie, who is now coach of South Australia's domestic sides and the Adelaide Strikers in the Big Bash League, was born in New South Wales.", "His family\u00a0moved to SA during the 1980s, when his father got a job at the State Bank.", "\"Growing up it was common knowledge, obviously, in my family and [among] all my friends. Everyone I knew, knew that our family was of Aboriginal heritage,\" he said.", "\"My late father Neil worked in Aboriginal legal rights, he was the CEO of the Aboriginal Legal Rights Movement in South Australia for many years. One of my younger brothers, Rob, is still a field officer there to this day.", "", "
Gillespie during a training session in India.(AFP)
", "As a child\u00a0he became \"completely and utterly obsessed\" with cricket and starting bowling against a painted set of stumps on a wall.", "\"There was no history of cricket in our family, in our extended family, at all,\" he said.", "Within a few years, the teenage Gillespie was representing his new state \u2014 which is how he came to acquire his moniker, Dizzy.", "\"There was a jazz trumpeter in America many years ago called Dizzy Gillespie. I got selected to play my first South Australian second XI game and we were travelling to Victoria,\" he said.", "\"One of the guys just said, 'Dizzy, after the jazz trumpeter', and from that moment it just stuck. It was as simple as that, there was no real fancy story.\"", "", "
The fast bowler's moniker derives from jazz trumpeter John Gillespie, who was also nicknamed 'Dizzy'.(Wikipedia - Roland Godefroy)
", "Indigenous cricket has a long, if often marginalised, history in Australia.", "Fast bowlers Jack Marsh and Eddie Gilbert \u2014 who famously dismissed Sir Donald Bradman in a state game\u00a0after knocking a bat from his hands \u2014 were among early pioneers.", "The Aboriginal side that toured England in 1868 was the first Australian representative squad \u2014 in any sporting endeavour \u2014 to leave its home shores.", "\"That tour should always have been acknowledged. Those guys were absolute trailblazers,\" Gillespie said.", "Unlike Gillespie, Boland was unaware of his Aboriginality until adulthood.", "But like Gillespie, he has embraced his family history.", "Boland was awarded the Johnny Mullagh\u00a0Medal \u2014 named in honour of the 1868 tour's leading player \u2014 after his performance in the Boxing Day Test.", "\"He's making this Test cricket look easy at the moment.\""]
